name: Grandma's Corn Chowder
author: CKINCAID1
summary: My husband's grandmother used to make this chowder for him when he was a child.  When we got married, she passed the recipe onto me. Enjoy!
directions: Place the bacon in a large pot over medium-high heat, and cook until crisp
Drain and crumble, reserving about 2 tablespoons drippings in the pot
Mix potatoes and onion into the pot with the crumbled bacon and reserved drippings
Pour in the water, and stir in corn
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cover pot
Simmer 20 minutes, stirring frequently, until potatoes are tender
Warm the half-and-half in a small saucepan until it bubbles
Remove from heat before it boils, and mix into the chowder just before serving
